text:
Hi All, don’t know what the right channel is so now I am trying here :slightly_smiling_face: we are having a problem with connecting Zoom to HubSpot as HubSpot import all recording into HubSpot including Board meeting, hiring interviews etc.

We would therefore like to build some logic that could remove calls, Ideal a workflow where we could set the criteria’s for what call to delete, however it is not possible to trigger workflows on calls. (some calls will not be associated)

we are therefore looking into alternative solutions like a microservice or like, do anyone of you have a good suggestion how to build / or buy this ?

Ideally something out of the box.

Hey! Yes! i removed both commas as you said but its still not working.... thats the only context parameter im using and the only section i have that is going to be used on my template. I dont know if it is well implemented but dont have any other information rather than the 2 minute video from the CMS for developers couurse. And there is nothing i could find on HubSpots documentation..
What's the name of your section's folder? Is it *sections* or *section (without "s")*?

Hi Dustin Perolio,
I think you can go with a third-party library such as `react-cookie-banner`. This library provides a simple way to add a cookie banner to a React app and customize its appearance and behaviour. `npm install react-cookie-banner`  
install this library in your project.
section, no s
the file is called section and the folder too

I mean you could definitely build a little cron job with an Ipaas platform like zapier or make. It would check for any new calls and if it found one then would delete it (if it meets the criteria obviously)

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!

Hey does anyone know if there is documentation for the default company properties. I see this <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/companies/HubSpot-crm-default-company-properties>,  but that only shows the display names of the properties. So for instance, if I wanted to set the "About Us" property  using POST request to /v3/objects/companies, idk if I should use "about-us", "about_us", "aboutus" etc etc
Based on what's available as options in the UI I think I already have my answer but can anybody confirm the following?

HubSpot ONLY supports CNAME values for subdomains (such as <http://www.pizza.com|www.pizza.com> )
HubSpot ONLY supports A RECORD values for root domains (such as <http://pizza.com|pizza.com> )
GET request to <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/properties/companies>
thankkk youuu

Hi there, I have an email with two images that use personalization tokens / HubSpot Properties as links. However, in the email analytics, it comes up as 0% in the HTML click map. How can I track the clicks of links that's not directly in an email but in a personalization token in the email?
Zapier don’t support calls have already checked
it actually does
I will have a look
ok
Now I can see that I can trigger on the call created, but how do I update the call record to delete the recording Link?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/calls>
You'll need to use the api call option to update the call through the endpoint:
Try to create a new page and select the template you created.
